677.sentence: kind of bulky and the wheel is awkward , but i can deal with that .

678.sentence: software definitely sucks , hangs up my notebook about half the time , but i do n't mind buying notmad .

679.sentence: i am annoyed that the player 's not automatically recognized as a hard drive .

680.sentence: i loved it until it broke , but less than a month is not an acceptible period of time for something to work .

681.sentence: i loved this product when i first got it - great sound , easy to use ( even though i agree that the software was n't the best ) and held enough songs to suit any mood .

684.sentence: i was willing to live with the larger size ( inconvenient on the road ) but the durability was a big zero .

685.sentence: always carried it in a case in by briefcase but one day the hard drive just zapped .

686.sentence: i am disappointed and looking elsewhere for something that can withstand the " rigor " of a business traveler .

687.sentence: the combination of the price , storage size , and player features makes this player the best on the market .

688.sentence: fact is , it could n't be easier to use .

689.sentence: sound quality on this is amazing , as with all creative products .

690.sentence: even leaving it on the default setting ( without the eax enhancements ) produces crystal clear playback .

691.sentence: the menu allows you to search for files by artist , genre , and album quite easily .

692.sentence: the battery stays charged for a long time , and takes no more than 2 or 3 hours at most to fully recharge via the included ac adapter .

693.sentence: connect the player to your computer ( via usb ) , open up mediasource , and you can listen to your stored mp3s as they stream directly from the xtra !

695.sentence: minor complaints : 1 ) even though the music is sorted via id3 tag on the player , the option to search for music contained in a folder is unavailable .

696.sentence: the zen xtra will transfer the files to the player , but not the folder name .

697.sentence: 2 ) having unfilled id3 tags will cause music to be potentially placed in a folder called " unknown . "

698.sentence: 3 ) with mediasource being so easy , i found no use for the bundled nomad explorer software .

699.sentence: in fact , it caused my system to hang more times than not , so i uninstalled it and stuck with mediasource 100 % .

701.sentence: first , the sound quality is okay , but ( as at least one other reviewer has mentioned ) the eax can cause audio interference after about 30 minutes .

702.sentence: second , the menu system and controls are poorly designed .

703.sentence: second , the menu system and controls are poorly designed .

704.sentence: the toggle button that is used to scroll is poorly designed and does not work well .

705.sentence: the general button placement is not very user friendly .

706.sentence: third , the poor design continues with the case .

707.sentence: overall , a good buy for the price .

708.sentence: easy enough to navigate through , although i 'd prefer a sturdier button besides the thumbwheel scroll / pushbutton .

709.sentence: my biggest complaint is the battery life or lack there of .

710.sentence: there is no way the battery supplied lasts 14 hours !

711.sentence: i 've also had the nomad zen lock-up several times .

712.sentence: the nomad zen could use a little sturdier construction like the archos jukeboxes or some kind of shock resistant case .

713.sentence: at the very least , a sturdier more protective carrying case would be nice .

726.sentence: what is added in functionality ( battery replacement ) detracts in build quality as the face plate is prone to popping off .

727.sentence: feedback on creative 's product support is universally poor ; this is not limited to the zen , it applies to all the company 's products .

728.sentence: the scroll wheel is finicky ; it works most of the time but there is a learning curve for pressing it just right ; new users say they have 50 % - 75 % success rate ; some find it so frustrating that they just return the device .

729.sentence: the creative software is awkward / difficult to use and just plain does n't load on some computers .

730.sentence: enough people have reported that their headphone jack does n't work after a month of using the device to believe that creative has some inbuilt manufacturing or quality control problem .

731.sentence: the zen does n't support folders so it is not really a storage device ; even with third party software that " creates " folders , documents and programs can 't be launched from the zen , so it is not a hard disk , it 's a storage device at best .

732.sentence: reviews for sound quality are generally ( but not universally ) positive .

733.sentence: sure , this thing is definitely more cost-effective than an ipod .

734.sentence: but with a low price , comes lower quality .

753.sentence: huge storage space , i loaded my entire collection of music , which isnt that much , 400 songs , and still have 26 gb , out of the 28 provided to you .

754.sentence: the sound is awesome , but if u put it too loud , depends on yoursound quality , the sound might crack .

755.sentence: with eax on , you can modify your sound , with 4 different presets , which is pretty good , you can get different variations with it .

756.sentence: if you use software correctly , put in all the id3 tags , you will get an awesome database collection , from which you can easily access your songs .

757.sentence: i dont know what other people are saying , but the software is awesome .

758.sentence: battery recharge , is an awesome thing , because it recharges in only like 2-3 hours .

759.sentence: when you turn on your player , the player turns on really fast , and the music continues to play , as you left it when you were turning it off .
